Computer Vision Groups

Source: http://www.vision.ee.ethz.ch/~rhayko/

This is a list of most well known Computer Vision groups from various Universities across the World.

North America

  1. Arizona State University - Image, Video, and Usability Lab
  2. Boston University - Image and Video Computing Group
  3. Brown University - Computer Vision
  4. California Institute of Technology - Computational Vision
  5. Carnegie Mellon University - Computer Vision Group
  6. Colorado State University - Computer Vision
  7. Columbia University - Computer Vision Laboratory
  8. Cornell University - Computer Vision Group
  9. Darthmouth University - Visual Learning Group
  10. Duke University - Duke Robotics Intelligence and Vision
  11. Florida State University - The Computer Vision Lab
  12. George Mason University - Computer Vision and Robotics Laboratory
  13. Georgia Institute of Technology - Vision
  14. Harvard University - Graphics, Vision & Interaction
  15. Harvard University - Visual Computing Group
  16. Harvard University - Visionlab
  17. Indiana University - Computer Vision lab
  18. John Hopkins University - Vision Lab
  19. Louisiana State University - Image Processing & Computer Vision Laboratory
  20. Massachusetts Institute of Technology - MIT Computer Vision
  21. McGill University - Center for Intelligent Machines
  22. Michigan State University - Computer Vision Lab
  23. North Carolina State University - Image Analysis and Computer Vision
  24. Northeastern University - Computational Vision Laboratory
  25. Northwestern University - Computational Vision Group
  26. Pennsylvania State University - Laboratory for Perception, Action and Cognition
  27. Princeton University - Princeton Vision and Robotics
  28. Purdue University - Purdue Robot Vision Lab

  34. Simon Frazer University - Vision and Media Lab
  35. Stanford University - Stanford Vision Lab
  36. Stony Brook University - Computer Vision Lab
  37. University of Alberta - Computer Vision and Robotics Research Group
  38. University of Buffalo - Computer Vision and Information Visualization
  39. University of California, Berkeley - Berkeley Vision and Learning Center
  40. University of California, Irvine - Computational Vision at UC Irvine
  41. University of California, Los Angeles - UCLA Vision Lab
  42. University of California, Santa Barbara - Vision Research Lab
  43. University of California, Santa Cruz - UCSC Computer Vision Lab
  44. University of California, Santa Diego - UCSD Computer Vision
  45. University of California, Santa Diego - Statistical Visual Computing Lab
  46. University of California, Riverside - Visualization and Intelligent Systems Laboratory
  47. University of Central Florida - Center for Research in Computer Vision

  49. University of Illinois, Chicago - Robotics
  50. University of Illinois, Chicago - Machine Vision Lab
  51. University of Illinois, Urbana Champaign - Computer Vision
  52. University of Illinois, Urbana Champaign - Computer Vision and Robotic Lab

  54. University of Manitoba - Computer Vision Lab
  55. University of Maryland - Computer Vision
  56. University of Maryland - Computer Vision Laboratory

  58. University of Massachusetts, Amherst - Computer Vision Lab
  59. University of Michigan - Michigan Vision and Learning Lab
  60. University of Minnesota - Digital Technology Center
  61. University of North Carolina, Chapel Hill - Computer Vision
  62. University of North Carolina, Charlotte - Computer Vision
  63. University of Ottawa - VIVA Lab
  64. University of Rochester - Center for Visual Science
  65. University of Southern California - USC Computer Vision
  66. University of Texas, Austin - UT-Austin Computer Vision Group
  67. University of Tennessee - Imaging, Robotics and Intelligent Systems Laboratory
  68. University of Utah - Utah Robotics Center

  70. University of Washington - Computer Graphics, Vision, Animation and Game Science
  71. University of Waterloo - Vision and Image Processing Lab

Europe

  1. Aristotle University of Thessaloniki - Artificial Intelligence Information Analysis
  2. Czech Technical University - Center for Machine Perception
  3. Democritus University of Thrace - Laboratory of Robotics and Automation
  4. ETH Zurich - Computer Vision Laboratory
  5. EPFL - Computer Vision Laboratory
  6. French Institute for Research in Computer Science and Automation (INRIA) - Perception, Cognition and Interaction
  7. Imperial College London - Imperial CV and Learning Lab
  8. IT University of Copenhagen - The Image Group
  9. Graz University of Technology - Institute for Computer Graphics and Vision
  10. KTH Royal Institute of Technology - Computer Vision and Active Perception Lab
  11. KU Leuven - Processing Speech and Images
  12. Max Planck Institute for Informatics - Computer Vision and Multimodal Computing
  13. RWTH Aachen University - Computer Vision Group
  14. Technical University Munich - Computer Vision Laboratory
  15. Trinity College, Dublin - Graphics, Vision and Visualisation
  16. University of Cambridge - Machine Intelligence Laboratory
  17. University of Edinburgh - CALVIN
  18. University of Leeds - Computer Vision
  19. University of Lyon - Informatics Laboratory in Image and Information Systems
  20. University of Lorraine - Lorraine Laboratory for Computer Research and Applications
  21. University of Paderborn - GET Lab - Cognitive Systems Engineering
  22. University of Oxford - Torr Vision Group
  23. University of Oxford - Visual Geometry Group

Australia

  1. The University of Adelaide - Australian Centre for Visual Technologies

Asia

  1. Bilkent University - RETINA Vision and Learning Group
  2. Hebrew University of Jerusalem - Computer Vision Lab
  3. Indian Institute of Science - Computer Vision Lab
  4. Indian Institute of Science - Video Analytics Laboratory (VAL)
  5. Indian Institute of Technology, Madras - Image Processing and Computer Vision Lab
  6. Nanyang Technological University - Computer Vision Laboratory
  7. National University of Singapore - Computer Vision Laboratory
  8. Tel Aviv University - Israel Computer Vision
